etymology.description: 很 + 好 = very + good (degree adverb + adjective) → “very good.”
etymology.interpretation: 很 functions as a degree adverb modifying 好 to indicate a high degree of goodness. In everyday Mandarin, 很 often appears before adjectives and may sound mildly emphatic unless contrasted or stressed.

parts.english: very; quite; rather; to a great extent

examples.chinese: 今天天气很好(今天天氣很好)。
examples.english: The weather is very good today.

examples.chinese: 这本书很好(這本書很好)。
这里的服务很好(這裡的服務很好)，价格也不贵(價格也不貴)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèlǐ de fúwù hěn hǎo, jiàgé yě bù guì.
examples.english: The service here is very good, and the prices aren’t expensive.
